required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: COVID-19 Protection After Transplant Pilot Study
clinical_study.official_title: Immunogenicity of a Third Dose of Either the Moderna COVID-19 Vaccine or Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 Vaccine in Kidney Transplant Recipients Who Failed to Respond After Two Previous Doses

lead_sponsor.agency: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

clinical_study.source: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases (NIAID)

brief_summary.textblock:
Antibodies are an important part of the body's defense against infection. Individuals who have no antibodies or very low antibody levels are considered less well protected from Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) than those who have higher antibody levels. What level of antibodies is necessary for protection is currently unknown.
Inadequate antibody response to Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome Coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) vaccination has been described among kidney transplant recipients. The aim of this study is to elicit an antibody response to vaccination against SARS-CoV-2 in kidney transplant recipients who have failed to respond to two doses of either the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine or Pfizer-BioNTech Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) vaccine.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an open label, non-randomized study in kidney transplant recipients who received two doses of either mRNA COVID-19 vaccine and have a negative (<0.8 U/mL) or low (titer <50 U/mL) SARS-CoV-2 antibody response using the Roche Elecsys® anti-RBD assay. Eligible participants will receive a third dose of the same mRNA vaccine as the prior two doses.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Who Achieve an Antibody Response >50 U/mL
primary_outcome.description: Efficacy measure status post third mRNA-1273 vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of Solicited Local Reactogenicity Adverse Events (AEs) to the mRNA-Based COVID-19 Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure status post third mRNA-1273 vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of Solicited Local Allergic Reaction Adverse Events (AEs) to the mRNA-Based COVID-19 Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure status post third mRNA-1273 vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of Solicited Systemic Reactogenicity Adverse Events (AEs) to the mRNA-Based COVID-19 Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure status post third mRNA-1273 vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of Solicited Systemic Allergic Reaction Adverse Events (AEs) to the mRNA-Based COVID-19 Vaccine
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure status post third mRNA-1273 vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of Any Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure status post third mRNA-1273 vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of Any Unsolicited Adverse Events (AEs)
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure. An AE associated with the third dose of vaccine and/or study mandated procedures.

secondary_outcome.measure: Frequency of Any Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure status post third mRNA-1273 vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants Treated for Acute Cell-Mediated and/or Antibody-Mediated Allograft Rejection
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure status post third mRNA-1273 vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants who Develop de Novo Donor-Specific Anti-Human Leukocyte Antigens (HLA) Antibody
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure status post third mRNA-1273 vaccination.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of Participants with Graft Loss
secondary_outcome.description: Safety measure status post third mRNA-1273 vaccination.
Safety measure status post third mRNA-1273 vaccination.

arm_group.description: The mRNA-1273 vaccine was developed to prevent COVID-19, the disease resulting from Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) infection. Kidney transplant recipients who had a suboptimal antibody response to the standard two doses of vaccination with Pfizer/BioNTech will receive a third dose of the the same vaccine. Administration: One dose administered intramuscularly, upper arm.

The mRNA-1273 vaccine was developed to prevent COVID-19, the disease resulting from Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) infection. Kidney transplant recipients who had a suboptimal antibody response to the standard two doses of vaccination with Moderna will receive a third dose of the same vaccine. Administration: One dose administered intramuscularly, upper arm.

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Surgery, Johns Hopkins University School of Medicine

reference.citation: Werbel WA, Boyarsky BJ, Ou MT, Massie AB, Tobian AAR, Garonzik-Wang JM, Segev DL. Safety and Immunogenicity of a Third Dose of SARS-CoV-2 Vaccine in Solid Organ Transplant Recipients: A Case Series. Ann Intern Med. 2021 Sep;174(9):1330-1332. doi: 10.7326/L21-0282. Epub 2021 Jun 15.

patient_data.ipd_description: The plan is to share data upon completion of the study in: Immunology Database and Analysis Portal (ImmPort), a long-term archive of clinical and mechanistic data from DAIT-funded grants and contracts.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: On average, within 24 months after database lock for the trial.
